list_definition.definition: a white plastic board, especially in a classroom, which you write on with a special pen containing ink that can be wiped off

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The teacher wrote the essay title on the whiteboard.

list_ex_of_english: They found that although interactive whiteboards are theoretically more than a computer if it is only being used as an adjunct to teaching its potential remains unrealized.
Many companies and projects now focus on creating supplemental instructional materials specifically designed for interactive whiteboards.
Interactive whiteboards are available in some classrooms and shared areas.
Classrooms, each of which accommodates six pupils, feature soundfield systems and interactive whiteboards.
Early whiteboards were made out of film laminate, the same glossy finish found on film negatives.
Mobile whiteboards are also used as temporary space dividers to allow more than one activity to be scheduled at a time.
Standard practices include passive status displays (whiteboards or screens in the surgical suites) and active displays (text pager notifications).
Each classroom uses interactive whiteboards as a resource for teaching.
